revision.comment: first goal + update career stats + Oxford squad
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2018}} {{Use British English|date=May 2014}} {{Infobox football biography | name=Jordan Graham | image= | fullname=Jordan Graham{{Cite news|title=Premier League Clubs submit Squad Lists |url=http://www.premierleague.com/content/dam/premierleague/site-content/News/publications/squad-lists/Premier-League-Squad-Lists-January-2014.pdf |publisher=Premier League |format=PDF |page=35 |date=4 February 2014 |accessdate=12 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140316063138/http://www.premierleague.com/content/dam/premierleague/site-content/News/publications/squad-lists/Premier-League-Squad-Lists-January-2014.pdf |archivedate=16 March 2014 |df= }} | birth_date={{birth date and age|1995|3|5|df=y}} | birth_place=[[Coventry]], England | height= | position=[[Midfielder#Winger|Winger]] | currentclub = [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]]
(on loan from [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]) | clubnumber = 18 | youthyears1 = 2002–2013 | youthclubs1 = [[Aston Villa Under-21s and Academy|Aston Villa]] | years1 = 2013–2015 | clubs1 = [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2013 | clubs2 = → [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] (loan) | caps2 = 2 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2014 | clubs3 = → [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City]] (loan) | caps3 = 1 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2014–2015 | clubs4 = → [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] (loan) | caps4 = 0 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2015– | clubs5 = [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] | caps5 = 14 | goals5 = 1 | years6 = 2015 | clubs6 = → [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] (loan) | caps6 = 5 | goals6 = 0 | years7 = 2017–2018 | clubs7 = → [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] (loan) | caps7 = 3 | goals7 = 0 | years8 = 2018–2019 | clubs8 = → [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] (loan) | caps8 = 4 | goals8 = 0 | years9 = 2019– | clubs9 = → [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] (loan) | caps9 = 8 | goals9 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2010 | nationalteam1 = Republic of Ireland U15 | nationalcaps1 = 2 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | nationalyears2 = 2010–2011 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] | nationalcaps2 = 5 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2011–2012 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps3 = 11 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | club-update = 15:06, 23 February 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = }} '''Jordan Graham''' (born 5 March 1995) is an English professional footballer who plays as a winger for [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] on loan from [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] . Graham has represented both [[England national football team|England]] and the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]] at youth level. He is a product of the [[Aston Villa Under-21s and Academy|Aston Villa Academy]], having spent twelve years there as a junior. ==Career== Graham is a product of the Aston Villa youth academy and was a member of their [[NextGen Series]] winning side in the 2012–13 season. He signed a professional contract with Villa in March 2012.{{cite web | url=http://www.avfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10265~2634177,00.html| title=Academy starlet Graham signs professional contract| publisher=Aston Villa F.C|date= 7 March 2012}} In November, he joined [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] on loan, where he made his professional debut on 7 December 2013 in a 2–1 win over [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield]].{{Cite web | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25163687 | title = Ipswich 2–1 Huddersfield | publisher = BBC Sport| date = 7 December 2013}} Graham also made an appearance in the victory over [[Doncaster Rovers F.C.|Doncaster Rovers]] before he returned to Villa at the end of December 2013.{{cite web | url = http://www.twtd.co.uk/ipswich-town-news/24305? | title= Loanee Returns to Villa | publisher=Ipswich Town F.C | date = 31 December 2013}} On 10 January 2014, he joined League One side [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City]] on a one-month loan deal,{{Cite web |title=Graham comes to city |url=http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/graham-joins-city-1285252.aspx |publisher=Bradford City AFC |date=10 January 2014}} for whom he made one appearance: against his future club [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] on 1 February 2014.{{Cite web | url =https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25891950| title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 2–0 Bradford City| publisher=BBC Sport| date=1 February 2014}} The winger joined Wolverhampton Wanderers, now returned to the Championship, in November 2014 on loan until the January transfer window.{{Cite web | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30238820| title =Aston Villa: Wolves sign midfielder Jordan Graham on loan| publisher = BBC Sport| date =27 November 2014}} Injury prevented him from making any appearances during this loan period,{{cite web | url =http://www.wolves.co.uk/news/article/jordan-graham-completes-move-2182698.aspx| title=Jordan Graham completes move| publisher = Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C | date = 5 January 2015}} but he signed a permanent 18-month deal with the club on 5 January 2015 for an undisclosed fee.{{cite web | url =https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30682931| title=Jordan Graham completes move| publisher =BBC Sport| date = 5 January 2015}} After failing to make a first-team appearance for Wolves, he was sent on a month-long loan to League Two side [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] in September 2015.{{cite news| title=Oxford United: Winger Jordan Graham set to join on loan|publisher=BBC Sport|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34381097|date=28 September 2015}} Following a successful initial month, his loan was extended by two months,{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34621656 |title=Jordan Graham: Winger extends Oxford loan by two months |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 October 2015|accessdate=27 October 2015}} but a few days later he was recalled by Wolves after an injury crisis at his parent club.{{cite web |url=http://www.oufc.co.uk/news/article/oxford-united-wolves-jordan-graham-2767506.aspx |title=Winger Graham Returns To Wolves |publisher=Oxford United F.C. |date=27 October 2015 |accessdate=27 October 2015}} Graham scored his first goal in his club career for Wolverhampton Wanderers on 28 December 2015 in the 52nd minute of a Championship game against [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]] at The Valley.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35147801 |title=Charlton Athletic 0 Wolverhampton Wanderers 2 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 December 2015 |accessdate=1 February 2016}} He suffered torn knee ligaments during a game against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] on 16 January 2016. Despite this, Graham extended his contract with Wolves until the end of the 2017–18 season, with the club having the option of two additional years.{{cite web| url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35533293| publisher=BBC Sport| title=Wolves: Jordan Graham and Kortney Hause extend contracts|date=9 February 2016}} The initial prognosis of his injury was that he was expected to be missing from action for between nine and 12 months,{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35343431 |title=Jordan Graham: Wolves winger out for nine months with injury |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 January 2016 |accessdate=1 February 2016}} but after suffering several setbacks during his recovery, he did not return to first-team football until 15 months later, on 25 April 2017, in a 1–0 defeat against [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield]] at Molineux.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39035260| publisher=BBC Sport| title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 0–1 Huddersfield Town|date=25 April 2017}} On 31 August 2017, he joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] rivals [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] on loan until the end of the season.{{cite web|url=https://www.wolves.co.uk/news/first-team/20170831-graham-loaned-to-fulham/|title=Graham Loaned To Fulham |publisher=Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|date=31 August 2017}} On 15 January 2018, after making just three league appearances, Graham returned to Wolves.{{cite web|url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2018/january/15/jordan-graham-returns-to-wolves|title=Graham Returns To Wolves|publisher=Fulham F.C.|date=15 January 2018|accessdate= 27 March 2018}} On 28 August 2018, Graham signed for [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] on a season-long loan.{{cite web|url=http://www.eadt.co.uk/sport/town-sign-wolves-winger-graham-1-5670222|title=Ipswich Town sign Wolves winger Jordan Graham|publisher=EADT|date=28 August 2018|accessdate= 28 August 2018}} After [[Paul Lambert]] replaced Paul Hurst as Ipswich manager, Graham began training with Oxford United, with a view to an official loan in January,[https://www.shropshirestar.com/sport/football/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2018/11/15/jordan-graham-snubbed-by-ex-wolves-boss-paul-lambert-at-ipswich/ "Jordan Graham snubbed by ex-Wolves boss Paul Lambert at Ipswich"] Shropshire Star November 15 2018 which was confirmed in December 2018.{{cite news |url=https://www.oxfordmail.co.uk/sport/oxfordunited/usnews/17319558.jordan-graham-to-return-on-loan-at-oxford-united-next-week/ |first=David |last=Pritchard |title=Jordan Graham to return on loan at Oxford United next week |newspaper=Oxford Mail |date=25 December 2018 |accessdate=4 January 2019}} He scored his first Oxford goal, and the second League goal of his career, with a well-taken free kick in a surprise away victory over [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] on 23 February 2019.{{cite news |url=https://www.oxfordmail.co.uk/sport/oxfordunited/usnews/17456186.oxford-united-hero-jordan-graham-on-a-high/ |first=Jack |last=Johnson |title=Oxford United hero Jordan Graham on a high |newspaper=Oxford Mail |date=25 February 2019 |accessdate=25 February 2019}} ==International career== Graham has played for the [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] side, being part of the squad that retained the 2010–11 [[Victory Shield]].{{cite web | url=http://www.thefa.com/england/All-Teams/Players/g/JordanGraham | title=Jordan Graham | publisher=www.thefa.com | accessdate=8 December 2013}} He has also represented the [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] side, playing in and winning the 2012 Algarve Tournament.{{cite web | url=http://www.avfc.co.uk/page/ReservesProfile/0,,10265~2388257,00.html | title=Jordan Graham Squad Profile | publisher=www.avfc.co.uk | accessdate=8 December 2013}} Graham also represented the [[Republic of Ireland national football team]] at under-15 level in the 2010 Tri-Nations tournament, scoring twice against Northern Ireland U15s.{{cite web|url=http://www.fai.ie/international/youth-teams/under-15/100982-republic-u15s-complete-double-over-north.html |title=Republic U15s Complete Double over North |publisher=Football Association of Ireland |accessdate=8 December 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131213001950/http://www.fai.ie/international/youth-teams/under-15/100982-republic-u15s-complete-double-over-north.html |archivedate=13 December 2013 |df= }}
